facilities.name: Bronchoscopy
facilities.currentDescription: Learn more about Bronchoscopy at Kongunad Hospital.
facilities: Our bronchoscopy suite effectively diagnoses a wide range of respiratory infections and airway diseases.
Three specialist pulmonologists operate the advanced equipment to ensure safe, accurate procedures.

facilities.name: Colonoscopy
facilities.currentDescription: Learn more about Colonoscopy at Kongunad Hospital.
facilities: A colonoscopy lets your doctor examine your large intestine to investigate symptoms such as abdominal pain, rectal bleeding, or changes in bowel habits.
It also helps prevent colorectal cancer, and our expert gastroenterologists and surgeons perform colonoscopy for both diagnosis and treatment.

facilities.name: ERCP
facilities.currentDescription: Learn more about ERCP at Kongunad Hospital.
facilities: We use advanced ERCP equipment, and all procedures are performed by experienced specialist surgeons.

facilities.name: Upper GI Scopy
facilities.currentDescription: Learn more about Upper GI Scopy at Kongunad Hospital.
facilities: Upper GI endoscopy is a non-surgical test that uses a flexible tube with a light and camera to view the oesophagus, stomach, and upper intestine.
Our expert gastroenterologists and surgeons perform endoscopic procedures for accurate diagnosis and effective treatment.

facilities.name: Dialysis Services
facilities.currentDescription: Learn more about Dialysis Services at Kongunad Hospital.

services.title: Hemodialysis Unit
services.content: Our Dialysis Department is one of the leading modern dialysis units in India. It is overseen by a full-time nephrologist and has a separate unit for zero-positive cases. Our technicians are fully trained in critical care, advanced dialysis techniques, and safety practices.

services.title: Peritoneal Dialysis Unit
services.content: Our specialists are highly experienced in peritoneal dialysis, which plays a vital role in saving many critically ill patients.

facilities.name: Emergency Services
facilities.currentDescription: Learn more about Emergency Services at Kongunad Hospital.

services.title: Accident & Trauma Centre
services.content: Our Accident & Trauma Care Unit is fully equipped with advanced emergency equipment, 24-hour CT and MRI scan facilities, and full-time consulting doctors to treat emergency situations. Our staff members are well trained in critical care, accident care, and trauma care. We also have emergency codes (Code Brain) and a rapid response team to manage medical and surgical emergencies.

services.title: Poison Centre
services.content: We have a separate wing for poisoning cases to manage poison emergencies. Our team is highly experienced in treating all types of poison emergencies. We also have centralized oxygen, suction, ventilators, syringe pumps, infusion pumps, and intubation facilities.

services.title: Emergency Medical & Surgical Services
content: Our casualty has adequate space, emergency instruments, infusion pumps, ventilators, monitors, oxygen and suction support.
Although we have every emergency medicine to treat emergencies.
We are strictly following triage system to separate critical cases and treat them depending on their needs.
Our casualty medical officers and staff nurses are regularly updated with evidence based practice.

services.title: Emergency Procedure Rooms
services.content: We have separate cabin for Emergency Procedures and Emergency Surgeries, which is located near emergency department to handle emergency case.

services.title: Ambulance Services
services.content: Our ambulance is considered as a MINI INTENSIVE CARE UNIT which has ventilators, monitors, oxygen supply, infusion pump emergency medicine and needed emergency equipments.

facilities: Kongunad Emergency services and rescue department is organized well to ensure advanced and quick emergency services for public by addressing different emergencies.

Kongunad emergency department (ED), well facilitated in advanced medical and surgical specialization in emergency medicine, the acute care of patients who present without prior appointment; either by their own means or by that of an ambulance.

facilities.name: Intensive Care Services
facilities.currentDescription: Learn more about Intensive Care Services at Kongunad Hospital.

services.title: Ventilator Facilities
services.content: We have various modern ventilators with advanced features that help us assess the patient’s condition, improvement, and response to treatment. Our ventilators are regularly checked to ensure safe and reliable performance.

services.title: Coronary Intensive Care Unit
content: Our coronary care unit is well equipped with cardiac equipment, crash carts, defibrillators, temporary pacemakers, ambulatory BP monitors, ventilators, syringe pumps, infusion pumps, and advanced cots.
Our CCU is staffed by three cardiologists and full-time intensivists. Our staff members are well trained in BLS, ACLS, and critical care.

services.title: Neonatal Intensive Care Unit
content: Our NICU is advanced and well equipped with incubators, warmers, and phototherapy machines. Our staff are well trained in neonatal resuscitation protocols and neonatal critical care.
Our equipment is regularly calibrated and maintained in good working condition.

services.title: Surgical Intensive Care Unit
services.content: Our post-operative ward is well equipped with monitors, oxygen supply, suction apparatus, ventilator support, and a dedicated nurses’ station.

services.title: Renal Intensive Care Unit
services.content: Our renal intensive care unit is fully equipped with advanced ventilators, high-flow oxygen machines, syringe pumps, infusion pumps, dialysis machines, centralized monitors, central oxygen, and central suction support to manage nephrology and urology critical cases.

services.title: Transplant Intensive Care Unit
content: Our TICU is spacious and equipped with a separate room for transplant cases and instruments such as ventilators, portable echo machines, portable X-ray machines, ECG machines, crash carts, defibrillators, bedside monitors, syringe pumps, and infusion pumps.
There are separate beds for donor and recipient cases.

facilities: Our ICU is spacious with separate rooms for infectious cases and is equipped with ventilators, high-flow oxygen machines, dialysis machines, monitors, and other critical-care equipment.
We maintain dedicated cupboards for emergency and non-emergency medicines.
Our intensivists and staff nurses are trained and regularly updated on evidence-based critical-care practices.

facilities.name: Operation Theatre Services
facilities.currentDescription: Learn more about Operation Theatre Services at Kongunad Hospital.

services.title: Major Operation Theater
content: Our hospital has two major operation theatres with advanced equipment and instruments designed for patient comfort and safety.
We have surgeons available 24 hours a day.
Our operation theatres are regularly fogged and disinfected with high-level disinfectants to prevent cross-infection.

services.title: Labour OT
services.content: The labour ward is equipped with two active labour beds and CTG monitors. Patients are monitored by trained labour ward staff and doctors 24×7.

The department is staffed by qualified M.Sc. and B.Sc. professionals.

facilities.name: Haematology

We have certified DMLT technicians available 24 hours a day.

facilities.name: Histopathology

The department has dedicated facilities and equipment for grossing and slide preparation.

facilities.name: Microbiology
facilities.currentDescription: Learn more about Microbiology at Kongunad Hospital.

Automated CLIA, GeneXpert, culture analyzers, and ELISA readers are available.
All systems are integrated with our Hospital Information System (HIS).

facilities: Our hospital reception is advanced, well-standardised, and well equipped, with a computerised registration process and BMI and weight measurement facilities.
We have a 24-hour emergency registration counter.
There are separate inpatient and outpatient registration counters for patient convenience and satisfaction.

ECG reports are dispatched within a defined time frame.

PPG is an effective tool for diagnosing various blood flow–related conditions.

We also have full-time technicians available round the clock to perform TMT procedures.

facilities.currentDescription: Learn more about Uroflow Studies at Kongunad Hospital.
facilities: We provide high-quality uroflowmetry in dedicated procedure rooms.
Our results are integrated with computer software to ensure accurate reporting.

facilities.name: Cardiac OPD
facilities.currentDescription: Learn more about Cardiac OPD at Kongunad Hospital.
facilities: Our Cardiac OPD is run by three full-time cardiologists and is supported by advanced equipment, a cardiac ICU, and cath lab facilities.
We also have a dedicated reception and nurses’ station for cardiac patients, and all cardiac investigations and treatments are available under one roof at the Kongunad Heart Centre.

facilities.name: Emergency OPD (Casualty)
facilities.currentDescription: Learn more about Emergency OPD (Casualty) at Kongunad Hospital.
facilities: Our casualty unit has adequate space, emergency instruments, infusion pumps, ventilators, monitors, oxygen, and suction support.
We maintain a full range of emergency medicines to manage critical situations.
We strictly follow a triage system to prioritise critical cases and treat patients according to their needs.
Our casualty medical officers and staff nurses are regularly updated on evidence-based practices.

facilities.currentDescription: Learn more about Main opd at Kongunad Hospital.

services.title: OPD Waiting Hall
services.content: Our OPD waiting hall has adequate space, light, ventilation, television, announcement and drinking water facilities and toilet facilities for patients and their relatives convenience.

facilities: The OPD wing is spacious, with separate cabins, adequate instruments, and private areas for physical examination.
A separate OPD nursing room is available for injections and dressings.
Safe drinking water facilities are provided.
There is a dedicated private room for injection administration.
Separate toilet facilities are available for patients and employees.

facilities.name: Obstetrics & Gynacology OPD
facilities.currentDescription: Learn more about Obstetrics & Gynacology OPD at Kongunad Hospital.

services.title: Well Woman Clinic For All Age Groups, Including:
content: Advanced & Innovative Technology Under One Roof
Evaluation of Menstrual Irregularities by Hormonal Assessment
Evaluation of Infertile Couples by Semen Analysis
Treatment of Peri and Postmenopausal Conditions i.e. Hormone Replacement Therapy, Prevention of Osteoporosis

facilities: The Obstetrics and Gynaecology Department specialises in antenatal care, gynaecological problems, issues related to menarche and menopause, infertility, and procedures such as loop insertion and removal.

An experienced team of doctors manage normal and operative deliveries and perform surgeries such as hysterectomy, ovarian cystectomy, surgery for ectopic pregnancy, tubal ligation, D & C, cervical biopsy, and excision of vulval or vaginal cysts.

facilities.name: Orthopaedic OPD
facilities.currentDescription: Learn more about Orthopaedic OPD at Kongunad Hospital.
facilities: The Department of Orthopaedics is a major super-speciality centre with specialist consultant doctors and specially trained healthcare providers.
We have modern speciality operation theatres and advanced orthopaedic equipment.
The department provides state-of-the-art treatment in trauma and accident surgery, joint replacements, sports medicine and arthroscopy, spine surgery, and deformity correction.
A well-equipped physiotherapy and rehabilitation unit in the OPD complex is staffed by experienced physiotherapists who help rehabilitate patients after surgical correction of deformities.

facilities.name: Pediatric OPD
facilities.currentDescription: Learn more about Pediatric OPD at Kongunad Hospital.
facilities: Paediatrics deals with the health and diseases of children, and our outpatient unit has a dedicated paediatric section.
This section provides emergency care, intensive care, routine check-ups, and vaccination services delivered by trained vaccinators and paediatricians.
A paediatrician is available for consultation during OPD hours (9:00 AM to 5:00 PM).
Inpatient care of children is supervised by specialists from the respective units.
During emergencies, a specialist paediatrician oversees treatment, and the PICU is located close to the children’s ward for rapid transfer.
Neonates receive special attention immediately after birth in our neonatal unit near the labour room and obstetric theatres.
A paediatrician supports the trained nurses during delivery, and all difficult or operative births are attended by a paediatric doctor.

facilities.name: Physicians OPD (Medical)
facilities.currentDescription: Learn more about Physicians OPD (Medical) at Kongunad Hospital.
facilities: Our Physicians OPD is staffed by experienced general physicians who manage a wide range of conditions across emergency medicine, family medicine, general medicine, and fever clinics.
We also have a separate wing to safely manage infectious cases.

facilities.name: Speciality OPD
facilities.currentDescription: Learn more about Speciality OPD at Kongunad Hospital.

facilities.name: Surgeons OPD (Surgical)
facilities.currentDescription: Learn more about Surgeons OPD (Surgical) at Kongunad Hospital.
facilities: We have separate consultation areas for each surgeon.
There is a dedicated wing for endoscopy services, including a separate suite for scopy procedures.
We have multiple private consultation rooms.
Our surgical team comprises highly experienced surgeons.
We also provide a modern day-care unit for short-stay procedures.

facilities.name: C-Arm
facilities.currentDescription: Learn more about C-Arm at Kongunad Hospital.
facilities: We are one of the leading centres, equipped with advanced radiological equipment.
Our C-arm machine is a state-of-the-art device that supports a wide range of therapeutic and diagnostic procedures.

facilities.name: Cath Lab
facilities.currentDescription: Learn more about Cath Lab at Kongunad Hospital.
facilities: Our cath lab is a modern, advanced facility staffed by three full-time interventional cardiologists. We also have a dedicated wing for post-procedure observation.
We have well-trained technicians and staff nurses to manage emergency situations.

facilities.name: CT
facilities.currentDescription: Learn more about CT at Kongunad Hospital.
facilities: Our CT scan room is spacious and well equipped, featuring a 16-slice BRIVO 385 CT scanner.
We also have an automated pressure injector for safe and precise contrast administration.

facilities.name: Digital X-Rays
facilities.currentDescription: Learn more about Digital X-Rays at Kongunad Hospital.
facilities: The Digital X-ray Department is staffed by full-time radiologists and radiographers.
We have various safety devices such as lead aprons, thyroid collars, gloves, TLD badges, and other radiation safety equipment.
Our machines are directly interfaced with the PACS system so radiologists and doctors can view images from anywhere within the network.
Radiology reports are recorded in the HIS and reviewed and approved by a radiologist to minimise errors.

facilities.name: ECHO / Transesophageal ECHO
facilities.currentDescription: Learn more about ECHO / Transesophageal ECHO at Kongunad Hospital.
facilities: Our ECHO room is spacious and dedicated, with three cardiologists providing expert interpretation.
Our ECHO technicians are well qualified and trained under the guidance of our cardiologists.
Our ECHO machines are advanced, computerised, and integrated with the Hospital Information System (HIS).

facilities.name: Mobile X-Ray Unit
facilities.currentDescription: Learn more about Mobile X-Ray Unit at Kongunad Hospital.
facilities: We have two advanced mobile X-ray units to diagnose critically ill patients, reducing delays and the need to shift patients from critical care areas to the X-ray unit.
Specialised technicians are available to operate the mobile X-ray units safely and efficiently.

facilities.name: MRI
facilities.currentDescription: Learn more about MRI at Kongunad Hospital.
facilities: Our MRI machine is an advanced SIGNA CREATOR 1.5 Tesla system.
Our MRI technicians are qualified and available 24 hours a day.

facilities.name: Ultrasound Scan
facilities.currentDescription: Learn more about Ultrasound Scan at Kongunad Hospital.
facilities: We have separate scan rooms and four advanced ultrasound machines that support accurate and innovative diagnostic imaging.
Our scan machines are integrated with the PACS system, enabling easy future reference and cross-comparison of studies.
Machines are regularly calibrated, and preventive and corrective maintenance is carried out on a routine basis.

facilities.currentDescription: Learn more about Ambulance at Kongunad Hospital.

services.title: Ambulance Services – 0422 4316000
services.content: Our ambulances function as mini intensive care units, equipped with ventilators, monitors, oxygen supply, infusion pumps, essential emergency medicines, and other critical equipment. We also have well-trained doctors, staff nurses, paramedical staff, and drivers. BLS and ACLS training sessions are conducted regularly for our teams.

facilities.name: MRD
facilities.currentDescription: Learn more about MRD at Kongunad Hospital.
facilities: We have separate cupboards for MLC case sheets, deceased patient case sheets, birth records, and other medical records.
We use deficiency checklists to review case sheet completion and tracer cards to identify any missing records.
We also maintain a medical audit checklist to periodically review case sheets.

facilities.name: Pharmacy
facilities.currentDescription: Learn more about Pharmacy at Kongunad Hospital.
facilities: We have both inpatient (IP) and outpatient (OP) pharmacies to improve patient convenience and reduce overcrowding.
We strictly follow NABH guidelines to prevent medication errors and stock discrepancies.
Medicines are arranged in alphabetical order to minimise search time.
Separate cupboards are designated for emergency and high-risk medicines.
All medicines are procured, stocked, and dispensed through a computer-based system to minimise dispensing errors.
